Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Ranthidiellum) of Anthidiellum: Preoccipital carina complete, or present only behind vertex, or absent; lamella or carina on pronotal lobe usually extending little mesad from lateral margin of scutum; axilla not extending laterally beyond lateral margin of scutum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Ranthidiellum) of Anthidiellum: T egula broadly rounded or almost transverse posteriorly; omaular carina extending to venter (in some Pycnanthidium very weak or perhaps absent on lower half of mesepisternum)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Ranthidiellum) of Anthidiellum: T1 without carina between anterior and dorsal surfaces; apex of mandible of female about 1.5 times as wide as base; body brown with red markings, or yellowish and black but without yellow on T1 to T4 (oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Loyolanthidium) of Anthidiellum: Postgradular parts of T2 to T5 of females and to T6 of males swollen laterally, so that, from above, sides of metasoma seem lobed; S5 of male without comb; mandible of female with preapical shoulder on lower margin, below lower tooth

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Loyolanthidium) of Anthidiellum: Preoccipital ridge strongly carinate behind vertex; keirotrichiate area along upper margin of hind tibia not sharply deﬁned (Western Hemisphere)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthidiellum s. str.) of Anthidiellum: Postgradular parts of T2 to T5 of females and to T6 of males swollen laterally, so that, from above, sides of metasoma seem lobed; S5 of male without comb; mandible of female with preapical shoulder on lower margin, below lower tooth

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthidiellum s. str.) of Anthidiellum: Preoccipital ridge not or scarcely carinate; keirotrichiate area along upper margin of hind tibia sharply deﬁned (palearctic region, India)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Callanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with deep median emargination about oneﬁfth as wide as tergum, and strong lateral tooth about midway between base and apex of exposed part of tergum, T6 thus appearing strongly four-toothed; S6 of male with two large, erect, heavily sclerotized, bare apical lobes between which lie the greatly elongated, retrorsely bent apices of the penis valves (nearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthidium s. str.) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthidium s. str.) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum rounded in proﬁle, not carinate or lamellate, not greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe with or without carina

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Nivanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Nivanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Nivanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Pronotal lobe carinate; axillar suture weak; scutoscutellar suture not in deep depression, scutellum thus nearly continuing proﬁle of scutum (scutellum strongly produced posteriorly as rather ﬂat structure ending in lamella) (Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Severanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Severanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Severanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Severanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum ending in lamella or large carina almost all the way across; hind basitarsus with longitudinal carina on outer surface; omaulus sharply angulate or weakly carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Severanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Posterior scutellar margin subtruncate as seen from above, its lateral part curved forward and becoming more or less longitudinal; antennae arising below level of middles of eyes, which converge strongly below, rendering clypeus unusually small (Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Gulanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Gulanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Gulanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Gulanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum ending in lamella or large carina almost all the way across; hind basitarsus with longitudinal carina on outer surface; omaulus sharply angulate or weakly carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Gulanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Posterior scutellar margin broadly rounded as seen from above, with small median emargination, laterally oblique, only at extreme end next to axilla sometimes becoming longitudinal; antennae arising near level of middles of eyes, which converge slightly to moderately(palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Turkanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Turkanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Turkanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Turkanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellar margin with broad median part neither carinate nor lamellate; hind basitarsus not carinate; omaulus rounded or forming rounded angle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Turkanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum as seen from above with margin gradually curved forward at each side to axillar margin; hind basitarsus of female less than four times as long as broad (palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Proanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with much smaller midapical emargination, lateral to which margin is entire or uncommonly denticulate, often with a relatively small lateral tooth; S6 of male variable but not as described above; penis valves not greatly elongate, not bent retrorsely

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Proanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum angulate in proﬁle (at least as seen obliquely to show proﬁle of lateral part of scutellum), strongly carinate or lamellate at least laterally, greatly overhanging metanotum and propodeum; pronotal lobe carinate or lamellate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Proanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Pronotal lobe with more or less anteriorly directed or erect, translucent lamella; axillar suture strong; scutoscutellar suture in depression, scutellum thus independently convex in proﬁle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Proanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellar margin with broad median part neither carinate nor lamellate; hind basitarsus not carinate; omaulus rounded or forming rounded angle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Proanthidium) of Anthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Scutellum as seen from above with margin more or less transverse, curved forward rather abruptly or angled forward at each side to axillar margin, angle often protruding posteriorly; hind basitarsus of female four or more times as long as broad (palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Anthodioctes s. str.) of Anthodioctes: Pronotal lobe shorter anteroposteriorly than tegula; stigma about twice as long as prestigma

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera A. (Bothranthidium) of Anthodioctes: Pronotal lobe as long anteroposteriorly as tegula; stigma about as long as prestigma

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Bathanthidium s. str.) of Bathanthidium: Fovea behind propodeal spiracle rounded, delimited by strong carina; T7 of male trilobed, median lobe longest (upper margin of propodeum without row of pits except laterally) (oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Manthidium) of Bathanthidium: Fovea behind propodeal spiracle elongate, weakly delimited; T7 of male simple or with slightly produced median lobe

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Manthidium) of Bathanthidium: Basal zone of propodeum not distinct, with irregular, sculptured, sloping pits laterally; T6 of male with elevated median section and concave lateral sections (oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Stenanthidiellum) of Bathanthidium: Fovea behind propodeal spiracle elongate, weakly delimited; T7 of male simple or with slightly produced median lobe

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera B. (Stenanthidiellum) of Bathanthidium: Basal zone of propodeum distinct laterally, with regular, shiny, nearly horizontal pits; T6 of male with surface convex (eastern palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Dianthidium s. str.) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Hind coxa with elongate ventral, apical spine in male, short tooth (best seen in lateral view) in female; hypostomal area dulled by ﬁne, dense punctation (nearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Deranchanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Hind coxa without tooth or spine; hypostomal area shiny between punctures

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Deranchanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Arolia absent; mouthparts in repose scarcely exceeding proboscidial fossa (male S5 without sclerotized apical comb) (Mexico)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Adanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Hind coxa without tooth or spine; hypostomal area shiny between punctures

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Adanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Arolia present; mouthparts in repose considerably exceeding proboscidial fossa

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Adanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Male S5 with sclerotized apical comb; female mandible short, its length considerably less than maximum clypeal width (North America)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Mecanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Hind coxa without tooth or spine; hypostomal area shiny between punctures

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Mecanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Arolia present; mouthparts in repose considerably exceeding proboscidial fossa

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera D. (Mecanthidium) of Dianthidium(Modiﬁed from Griswold and Michener, 1988): Male S5 without sclerotized apical comb; female mandible long, its length equal to maximum clypeal width (Mexico)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Hemidiellum) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Subantennal suture straight; inner surface of hind tibia curving onto upper margin without sharp line between keirotrichiate area and region of longer hairs (arolia present; scutoscutellar suture closed, similar to scutoaxillar suture; T4 to T6 of female and T5 and T6 of male with small lateral spines) (India)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Salemanthidium) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Subantennal suture strongly arcuate outward; inner surface of hind tibia ﬂat, keirotrichiate area ending abruptly at sharp, often carinate line along upper margin of tibia

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Salemanthidium) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Arolia absent; proﬁle of T6 of female convex; T4 to T6 with lateral spines (scutoscutellar suture closed, similar to scutoaxillar suture) (India)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Clistanthidium) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Subantennal suture strongly arcuate outward; inner surface of hind tibia ﬂat, keirotrichiate area ending abruptly at sharp, often carinate line along upper margin of tibia

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Clistanthidium) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Arolia present; proﬁle of T6 of female concave (convex distally in subgenus Clistanthidium); T4 and T5 without lateral spines

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Clistanthidium) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Front coxa with strong carina or lamella transverse to axis of body or bending posteriorly and becoming longitudinal mesally; S6 of female not thickened apically, without lateral carina or spine; T6 of male with lateral tooth; scutoscutellar suture sometimes not very different from scutoaxillar suture (palearctic, Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Eoanthidium s. str.) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Subantennal suture strongly arcuate outward; inner surface of hind tibia ﬂat, keirotrichiate area ending abruptly at sharp, often carinate line along upper margin of tibia

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Eoanthidium s. str.) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Arolia present; proﬁle of T6 of female concave (convex distally in subgenus Clistanthidium); T4 and T5 without lateral spines

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Eoanthidium s. str.) of Eoanthidium(Modiﬁed from Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Front coxa without transverse carina or lamella; S6 of female thickened apically, with lateral carina or spine; T6 of male without lateral tooth; scutoscutellar suture open, with shiny impunctate ﬂoor divided medially to form two foveae (palearctic, Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Carloticola) of Epanthidium (Males): T egula widest in front of middle; body length 9 to 12 mm; lamella of pronotal lobe opaque, black or dusky (South America, Mexico)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Ananthidium) of Epanthidium (Males): T egula widest near middle; body length 6.5-8.0 mm; lamella of pronotal lobe translucent (South America)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Carloticola) of Epanthidium (Females): T6 without longitudinal carina; lamella of pronotal lobe opaque, blackish (S6 with premarginal carina enlarged to form tooth on each side of apex of sternum)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Epanthidium s. str.) of Epanthidium (Females): T6 with longitudinal median carina; lamella of pronotal lobe translucent

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Epanthidium s. str.) of Epanthidium (Females): Clypeal apex truncate, nodulose, only slightly overhanging base of labrum, labrum therefore exposed when mandibles are closed; juxtantennal carina of Epanthidium type present although sometimes minute; S6 with premarginal carina enlarged to form one to four premarginal teeth

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Ananthidium) of Epanthidium (Females): T6 with longitudinal median carina; lamella of pronotal lobe translucent

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera E. (Ananthidium) of Epanthidium (Females): Clypeal apex broadly rounded, rather thin, scarcely nodulose, overhanging base of labrum, labrum therefore hidden when mandibles are closed; juxtantennal carina absent or virtually so; S6 without premarginal carina or teeth, margin thin

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Rhynostelis) of Hoplostelis: Scutellum bigibbous; scutum bigibbous posteriorly; propodeum without foveae or pits; omaulus lamellate almost to lower end; T1 without transverse carina at summit of anterior surface; T4 to T6 (at least in female) each with longitudinal median carina (Brazil)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hoplostelis s. str.) of Hoplostelis: Neither scutellum nor scutum bigibbous; propodeum with well-deﬁned fovea, divided by transverse carinae, behind spiracle, continued as basal propodeal zone divided into many pits or small foveae; omaulus carinate in upper one-half or one-third, rounded below; T1 with transverse carina at summit of anterior surface; terga without longitudinal median carinae

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Michanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with long, smooth apical margin between two small, lower apical teeth and upper apical angle or tooth; surface of distal half of mandible of female dull and minutely granular, without longitudinal carinae or with slender carinae that do not extend onto basal half of mandible; mandible of male with upper tooth separated from middle tooth by broad concave margin, upper interspace nearly twice as long as lower interspace; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female with coarse, erect, curved or hooked hairs on undersurface

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Michanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female without distinct upper apical tooth, surface without carinae; hind coxa of male with small apical spine directed mesad; distal margin of T6 of male with lateral tooth but otherwise unmodiﬁed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Larocanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with long, smooth apical margin between two small, lower apical teeth and upper apical angle or tooth; surface of distal half of mandible of female dull and minutely granular, without longitudinal carinae or with slender carinae that do not extend onto basal half of mandible; mandible of male with upper tooth separated from middle tooth by broad concave margin, upper interspace nearly twice as long as lower interspace; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female with coarse, erect, curved or hooked hairs on undersurface

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Larocanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with strong upper apical tooth separated from long smooth margin by deep emargination, surface with usual carinae but carinae weak; hind coxa of male unarmed; distal margin of T6 of male with obtuse lateral tooth, margin medially expanded, elevated, sometimes bilobed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dichanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dichanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T egula large, with depressed translucent marginal area expanded anterolaterally, much wider there than midlaterally; body hoplitiform (arolia present in both sexes; T7 of male bilobed)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Mielkeanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Mielkeanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Mielkeanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female three-toothed; S4 of male with small but strong basal median comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Ctenanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Ctenanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Ctenanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Ctenanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia well developed in both sexes; S3 of male with median marginal comb of coarse black setae that are shorter than hairs of fringe on same margin laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Saranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Saranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Saranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Saranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Saranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia of male absent; T7 of male bilobed, emargination between lobes about as wide as a lobe; S5 of male with apical comb; tegula widest in front of middle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dicranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dicranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dicranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dicranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dicranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia of male present; T7 of male with narrow apicolateral lobes, space between them much wider than a lobe or, rarely [as in H. (Moureanthidium) capixaba(Urban)], lobes triangular and separated by broad emargination; S5 of male without apical comb (but with rows of coarse setae in Dicranthidium); tegula widest near middle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Dicranthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T6 and T7 of male curled anteriorly, their surfaces thus directed ventrad and processes of T7 overlapping S2; S3 or S4 to S6 of male hidden; hind coxa of male with one or more coarse peglike setae on mesal surface; omaular carina extending onto venter of thorax (scutellum produced to translucent apical carina except medially)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia of male present; T7 of male with narrow apicolateral lobes, space between them much wider than a lobe or, rarely [as in H. (Moureanthidium) capixaba(Urban)], lobes triangular and separated by broad emargination; S5 of male without apical comb (but with rows of coarse setae in Dicranthidium); tegula widest near middle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: T6 and T7 of male not so strongly curled (except in Moureanthidium), T6 not clearly directed ventrad; S3 to S5 or S6 ordinarily visible; hind coxa of male without peglike setae; omaular carina on upper half of mesepisternum, disappearing or becoming irregular because of punctation below

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Scutellum swollen, biconvex; omaular carina extending onto lower half of mesepisternum as irregular line (hind tarsus of male elongate, ﬁrst two segments taken together as long as hind tibia)..H. (Hypanthidioides s. str.) —. Scutellum not biconvex; omaular carina not extending onto lower one-half or one-third of mesepisternum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Moureanthidium) of Hypanthidioides: Hind tarsus of male elongate, ﬁrst two segments taken together as long as hind tibia; S3 of male with small median bilobed projection; T7 of male strongly curled, surface thus directed ventrad; juxtantennal carina longer than diameter of antennal socket

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female with three or four more or less evenly spaced teeth; surface of female mandible not or less dull, with strong longitudinal carinae extending onto basal half; mandible of male with teeth more evenly spaced; ﬁrst segment of labial palpus of female without erect, curved or hooked hairs

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: T egula normal, its depressed translucent margin not much broader anterolaterally than midlaterally; body more robust, hoplitiform to chalicodomiform

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: Mandible of female four-toothed; S4 of male without comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia absent or extremely minute in females and some males; S3 of male without apical comb

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: Arolia of male present; T7 of male with narrow apicolateral lobes, space between them much wider than a lobe or, rarely [as in H. (Moureanthidium) capixaba(Urban)], lobes triangular and separated by broad emargination; S5 of male without apical comb (but with rows of coarse setae in Dicranthidium); tegula widest near middle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: T6 and T7 of male not so strongly curled (except in Moureanthidium), T6 not clearly directed ventrad; S3 to S5 or S6 ordinarily visible; hind coxa of male without peglike setae; omaular carina on upper half of mesepisternum, disappearing or becoming irregular because of punctation below

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: Scutellum swollen, biconvex; omaular carina extending onto lower half of mesepisternum as irregular line (hind tarsus of male elongate, ﬁrst two segments taken together as long as hind tibia)..H. (Hypanthidioides s. str.) —. Scutellum not biconvex; omaular carina not extending onto lower one-half or one-third of mesepisternum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Anthidulum) of Hypanthidioides: Hind tarsus of male shorter, ﬁrst two segments taken together shorter than hind tibia; S3 of male without median, bilobed projection; T7 of male not so strongly curled; juxtantennal carina about as long as diameter of antennal socket

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Tylanthidium) of Hypanthidium: Preoccipital carina present as a sharp although punctate ridge laterally, behind eye; mandible of male bidentate, with strong, broad emargination between teeth; S2 of male with strong projection on each side

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera H. (Hypanthidium s. str.) of Hypanthidium: Preoccipital carina absent; mandible of male with indications of three teeth; S2 of male with at most weak convexity on each side

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera N. (Notanthidium s. str.) of Notanthidium: Body hoplitiform; clypeus of female largely impunctate, upper part tumescent, lower margin with sublateral projection; clypeus in both sexes not at all overhanging base of labrum; mandible of female porrect, with deep emargination in upper margin just beyond middle, width of its apex less than basal width, three-toothed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera N. (Chrisanthidium) —. Omaulus rounded; mandible of female obscurely four- toothed ................................................ N. (Allanthidium) of Notanthidium: Body chalicodomiform; clypeus of female punctate, not tumescent, without apical projections; apical margin of clypeus in both sexes overhanging base of labrum; mandible of female of the usual shape, width of its apex at least as great as basal width, vaguely four-toothed or with long straight margin above two lowermost teeth, sometimes undulate, thus producing a vaguely ﬁvetoothed margin

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera N. (Chrisanthidium) —. Omaulus rounded; mandible of female obscurely four- toothed ................................................ N. (Allanthidium) of Notanthidium: Omaulus carinate; mandible of female obscurely ﬁvetoothed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Ausanthidium) of Pachyanthidium: Eyes hairless; preoccipital carina absent laterally, behind eyes

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Ausanthidium) of Pachyanthidium: Arolia present; mandible of female four-toothed (Namibia)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pachyanthidium s. str.) of Pachyanthidium: Eyes hairless; preoccipital carina absent laterally, behind eyes

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pachyanthidium s. str.) of Pachyanthidium: Arolia absent; mandible of female usually ﬁveto tentoothed or denticulate (four-toothed only in Pachyanthidium micheneri Pasteels) (Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Trichanthidium) of Pachyanthidium: Eyes with abundant, short hairs; preoccipital carina present laterally, behind eyes (mandible of female fourtoothed)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Trichanthidium) of Pachyanthidium: T3 to T5 each with slender lateral spine; ocelli small, diameter about equal to width of base of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment; hind coxa not carinate; arolia present in male, absent in female (Africa, oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Trichanthidioides) of Pachyanthidium: Eyes with abundant, short hairs; preoccipital carina present laterally, behind eyes (mandible of female fourtoothed)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Trichanthidioides) of Pachyanthidium: T3 to T5 without lateral spines; ocelli of ordinary size, diameter greater than width of base of ﬁrst ﬂagellar segment; hind coxa carinate; arolia absent (possibly with very minute arolia in both sexes) (Africa, Arabia)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Paranthidium s. str.) ofParanthidium: Propodeum with postspiracular fovea; T6 of male without lateral lobe; S4 of male with median comb, S5 with comb laterally (nearctic, Mesoamerica)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Rapanthidium) ofParanthidium: Propodeum without postspiracular fovea or with fovea only about the size of the spiracle; T6 of male with lateral lobe; sterna of male without combs (Mesoamerica)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Spinanthidiellum) of Plesianthidium: Preoccipital ridge with carina behind vertex; T6 of male truncate, without lateral tooth, with longitudinal ridge distally, highest at posterior margin of tergum; mandible less than twice as long as broad

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Carinanthidium) of Plesianthidium: Preoccipital ridge not carinate; T6 of male with median truncate or rounded to pointed projection, rarely weakly produced, and a strong lateral tooth; mandible over twice as long as broad

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Carinanthidium) of Plesianthidium: S6 of female with strong longitudinal median carina; hind trochanter of male with mesal subapical spine; pubescence all black except for white on face of male

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Spinanthidium) of Plesianthidium: Preoccipital ridge not carinate; T6 of male with median truncate or rounded to pointed projection, rarely weakly produced, and a strong lateral tooth; mandible over twice as long as broad

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Spinanthidium) of Plesianthidium: S6 of female not carinate; hind trochanter of male not spined; pubescence brown to gray, or with whitish on face and venter

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Spinanthidium) of Plesianthidium: T7 of male strongly triﬁd, median tooth or lobe exceeding lateral ones; S5 of male without apical comb; maxillary palpus two-segmented

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Plesianthidium s. str.) of Plesianthidium: Preoccipital ridge not carinate; T6 of male with median truncate or rounded to pointed projection, rarely weakly produced, and a strong lateral tooth; mandible over twice as long as broad

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Plesianthidium s. str.) of Plesianthidium: S6 of female not carinate; hind trochanter of male not spined; pubescence brown to gray, or with whitish on face and venter

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Plesianthidium s. str.) of Plesianthidium: T7 of male with median tooth reduced to low prominence, tergum thus essentially biﬁd; S5 of male with apical comb; maxillary palpus three-segmented

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Micranthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Gena margined posteriorly by distinct preoccipital carina (gena narrower than eye as seen from side)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Micranthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Preoccipital carina behind vertex strongly produced back over front of thorax as a lamella; posterior basitarsus of male more than twice as long as broad (scutellum broadly truncate in dorsal view, posterior margin angulate laterally near axilla; tibiae not tuberculate but coarsely punctate; lateral lobe of S3 of male lamellate; clypeus of female with discal hairs bent down apically) (Africa, Arabia)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Semicarinella) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Gena margined posteriorly by distinct preoccipital carina (gena narrower than eye as seen from side)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Semicarinella) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Preoccipital carina behind vertex rather weakly carinate; posterior basitarsus of male less than twice as long as broad (Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Tuberanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Tuberanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Propodeum shagreened; T6 of male with strong apical, medially emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long plumose hair (Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Exanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Exanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Propodeum shiny where not punctate; T6 of male without emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long but not plumose hair

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Exanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with surface broadly and conspicuously excavated; T5 of female with small, midapical, marginal projecting lobe; exposed part of T7 of male longer than exposed part of T6, very deeply bilobed; S5 of male without strong lateral tooth or lobe (palearctic, Sudan)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Royanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Royanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Propodeum shiny where not punctate; T6 of male without emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long but not plumose hair

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Royanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with surface largely convex; T5 of female without midapical lobe; exposed part of T7 of male shorter than exposed part of T6, weakly to strongly bilobed; S5 of male with strong lateral process

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Royanthidium) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Clypeal apex of female fully exposed, coarsely denticulate, protruding; S3 and S4 of male broadly emarginate, or S3 with median V-shaped emargination, and S5 with apicolateral projection, all without combs or specialized hairs (palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pseudoanthidium s. str.) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Gena without preoccipital carina (scutellum rounded or medially emarginate as seen from above; tibiae tuberculate on outer surfaces at least in female; male without lamellate lateral lobe on S3; clypeus of female with discal hairs straight)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pseudoanthidium s. str.) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Propodeum shiny where not punctate; T6 of male without emarginate ﬂange; fore and middle basitarsi of female with long but not plumose hair

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pseudoanthidium s. str.) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): T6 of female with surface largely convex; T5 of female without midapical lobe; exposed part of T7 of male shorter than exposed part of T6, weakly to strongly bilobed; S5 of male with strong lateral process

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera P . (Pseudoanthidium s. str.) of Pseudoanthidium(From Michener and Griswold, 1994a): Clypeal apex of female largely hidden by hair, without shining premarginal ridge; S3 of male with comb of long, wavy bristles and S5 with comb at apex of apicolateral projection (palearctic, oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Rhodanthidium s. str.) of Rhodanthidium: T6 of male with median, produced truncation or rounded process and lateral tooth or strong shoulder; S5 of male with strong lateral tooth and median marginal comb; omaulus weakly carinate above; margin of scutellum with sharp edge laterally; female with apical projection or spine of fore and mid tibiae narrowly bidentate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Asianthidium) of Rhodanthidium: T6 of male simple or with scarcely produced broad truncation, with or without strong shoulder or weak lateral tooth; S5 of male without lateral tooth, without comb; omaulus not carinate [or weakly so above in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense (Giraud) and its relatives]; margin of scutellum rounded, not forming sharp edge [except in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense]; female with apical projection of fore and mid tibiae either not notched or widely and shallowly emarginate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Asianthidium) of Rhodanthidium: T riﬁd apex (median tooth sometimes broad and rounded or truncate) of T7 of male occupying full width of tergum; pronotal lobe with lamella or carina [weak in R. (Asianthidium) glasunovi(Morawitz)]; head with background color black

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Meganthidium) of Rhodanthidium: T6 of male simple or with scarcely produced broad truncation, with or without strong shoulder or weak lateral tooth; S5 of male without lateral tooth, without comb; omaulus not carinate [or weakly so above in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense (Giraud) and its relatives]; margin of scutellum rounded, not forming sharp edge [except in R. (Asianthidium) caturigense]; female with apical projection of fore and mid tibiae either not notched or widely and shallowly emarginate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera R. (Meganthidium) of Rhodanthidium: T riﬁd apex of T7 of male much narrower than tergum, which has lateral angles rendering tergum ﬁve-toothed; pronotal lobe without or with very weak carina; head largely yellow

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelidomorpha) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Clypeus produced well over mandibles, its apex bilobed, strongly so in females; anterior spine of front and middle tibiae conspicuous, enlarged, curved posteriorly

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Malanthidium) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Axilla projecting laterally beyond lateral margin of scutum; scutellum strongly projecting over metanotum and propodeum (oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelis s. str.) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelis s. str.) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Scutellum not carinate laterally; head and thorax without light markings; hind tibial apex with two spines or angles (Fig. 82-13b), one near outer middle of apical tibial margin (if with only one spine, as in S. simillima Morawitz, then not on posterior apical angle) or the spines united to form truncate margin, the area sparsely hairy and the structure thus easily seen; omaulus not carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Heterostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Heterostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Scutellum carinate laterally; head and thorax with light markings; hind tibial apex with a single spine (sometimes a mere angle) largely hidden in hairs (Fig. 82-13a) near the posterior apical angle of the tibia, in front of which the apex of the tibia presents a convex margin; omaulus usually carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Heterostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Hind basitarsus with carina along inner dorsal angle (Fig. 82-13a); middle tibia ﬂattened, apically enlarged, twice as wide apically as basally; S1 with transverse carina overhanging apical margin

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Protostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Protostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Scutellum carinate laterally; head and thorax with light markings; hind tibial apex with a single spine (sometimes a mere angle) largely hidden in hairs (Fig. 82-13a) near the posterior apical angle of the tibia, in front of which the apex of the tibia presents a convex margin; omaulus usually carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Protostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Hind basistarsus without carina; middle tibia not ﬂattened, little enlarged apically, at most 1.5 times as wide apically as basally; S1 without transverse carina

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Protostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Pronotum without notch between lobe and rest of pronotum; omaulus not carinate; carinate pitted basal zone of propodeum extending behind spiracle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Pseudostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Axilla not projecting laterally beyond margin of scutum; scutellum at most weakly projecting over metanotum and propodeum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Pseudostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Scutellum carinate laterally; head and thorax with light markings; hind tibial apex with a single spine (sometimes a mere angle) largely hidden in hairs (Fig. 82-13a) near the posterior apical angle of the tibia, in front of which the apex of the tibia presents a convex margin; omaulus usually carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Pseudostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Hind basistarsus without carina; middle tibia not ﬂattened, little enlarged apically, at most 1.5 times as wide apically as basally; S1 without transverse carina

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Pseudostelis) of Stelis of the Eastern Hemisphere: Pronotum with notch between lobe and rest of pronotum; omaulus usually carinate; carinate pitted basal zone of propodeum not extending behind spiracle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Heterostelis) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere: Hind tibia with a single prominent tooth or tibial spine (usually hidden among hairs) on margin near apex of posterior margin of tibia; hind basitarsus with strong lamella-like carina along posterior margin, separated by longitudinal depression from longitudinal thickening of outer surface of basitarsus (Fig. 82-13a)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Dolichostelis) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere: Hind tibia with an apical median tooth or tibial spine and a less prominent, rounded projection near apex of posterior margin of tibia; hind basitarsus unmodiﬁed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Dolichostelis) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere: Base of propodeum with zone set off by carina and divided into a series of pits (Fig. 82-14), this zone projecting subhorizontally behind vertical metanotum; anterior surface of mesepisternum impunctate at least below and set off from lateral surface by sharp angle or weak omaular carina

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelis s. str.) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere: Hind tibia with an apical median tooth or tibial spine and a less prominent, rounded projection near apex of posterior margin of tibia; hind basitarsus unmodiﬁed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera S. (Stelis s. str.) of Stelis of the Western Hemisphere: Base of propodeum vertical or sloping, rarely subhorizontal, without series of pits or such pits usually present only laterally, this zone with about same slope as metanotum; anterior surface of mesepisternum punctate, omaular carina absent

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Trachusa s. str.) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Mandible of female with three more or less equidistant teeth; maxillary palpus as long as maximum width of galea, four-segmented (yellow markings absent except for face of male) (palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Archianthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Mandible of female fourto seven-toothed; maxillary palpus shorter than width of galea, threeor foursegmented

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Archianthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Second recurrent vein entering second submarginal cell basal to second submarginal crossvein; T7 of male with median basal projection (palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Orthanthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Scutellum truncate posteriorly as seen from above, margin curved sharply forward laterally to meet longitudinal margin of axilla; eyes of female conspicuously diverging below; interocellar distance of female much less than half the ocelloccipital distance (male unknown) (oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Paraanthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Scutellum broadly rounded but medially emarginate; lateral margin of axilla convex but in general slanting; eyes of female subparallel; interocellar distance about half of ocelloccipital distance or somewhat greater (palearctic, oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Massanthidium) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Omaulus distinctly carinate, carina extending onto ventral surface of thorax close to middle coxa (Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Metatrachusa) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Omaulus not carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Metatrachusa) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Arolia present in female, absent in male; S4 and S5 of male without combs (oriental)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Congotrachusa) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Omaulus not carinate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Congotrachusa) of Trachusa of the EasternHemisphere: Arolia minute if present; S4 and S5 of male with combs as in Paraanthidium(Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Heteranthidium) of Trachusaof North America: All tagmata with abundant yellow or cream-colored markings, including median tergal bands on metasoma

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Ulanthidium) of Trachusaof North America: Integument without yellow or cream-colored markings except usually on face of male and, in Legnanthidium, on apical metasomal tergal margins

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Ulanthidium) of Trachusaof North America: Arolia absent

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Legnanthidium) of Trachusaof North America: Integument without yellow or cream-colored markings except usually on face of male and, in Legnanthidium, on apical metasomal tergal margins

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Legnanthidium) of Trachusaof North America: Arolia present

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Legnanthidium) of Trachusaof North America: Second recurrent vein joining second submarginal cell basal to second submarginal crossvein; mandible of female four-toothed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Trachusomimus) of Trachusaof North America: Integument without yellow or cream-colored markings except usually on face of male and, in Legnanthidium, on apical metasomal tergal margins

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Trachusomimus) of Trachusaof North America: Arolia present

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera T . (Trachusomimus) of Trachusaof North America: Second recurrent vein distal to second submarginal crossvein; mandible of female three-toothed

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Aglaoapis of the Dioxyini(From Michener, 1996b): Scutellum with posterior margin rounded

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Aglaoapis of the Dioxyini(From Michener, 1996b): Metanotum with median tooth; posterior lateral angle of scutum produced to a strong spine (as in Fig. 83-1); third valvula (gonostylus) of female with only minute hairs (palearctic, India, Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Megachile of the Megachilini (Females): Scopa present on S2 to S5 or S6 (Fig. 8-7); metasoma not tapering throughout its length (Fig. 8-3)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Coelioxys (in part) of the Megachilini (Females): Scopa absent; metasoma tapering from near base to narrow, often acutely pointed, apex (Figs. 8-2, 84-2, 84-3)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Coelioxys (in part) of the Megachilini (Females): Omaular carina present; scutellum with dorsal and posterior surfaces usually separated by distinct, sometimes carinate, angle; axilla almost always produced posteriorly to angle or spine (Fig. 84-6a)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Coelioxys: C. gracillima Pasteels of the Megachilini (Females): Scopa absent; metasoma tapering from near base to narrow, often acutely pointed, apex (Figs. 8-2, 84-2, 84-3)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Coelioxys: C. gracillima Pasteels of the Megachilini (Females): Omaular carina absent; scutellum with no distinct angle between dorsal and posterior surfaces; axilla rounded (Fig. 8-2)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Coelioxys: C. gracillima Pasteels of the Megachilini (Females): Preoccipital carina absent; axilla and scutellum forming a single rounded posterior margin, not separated by incision; base of propodeum with row of strong pits (Africa)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Radoszkowskiana of the Megachilini (Females): Scopa absent; metasoma tapering from near base to narrow, often acutely pointed, apex (Figs. 8-2, 84-2, 84-3)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Radoszkowskiana of the Megachilini (Females): Omaular carina absent; scutellum with no distinct angle between dorsal and posterior surfaces; axilla rounded (Fig. 8-2)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Radoszkowskiana of the Megachilini (Females): Preoccipital carina present at sides of head; axilla separated by incision from scutellar margin; base of propodeum ﬁnely wrinkled (palearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Genera Megachile of the Megachilini (Females): Scopa present on S2 to S5 or S6 (Fig. 8-7); metasoma not tapering throughout its length (Fig. 8-3)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Scutellum usually well punctured, hind margin not carinate and not overlying metanotum except sometimes for a median angle or tubercle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Concavity of T1 lacking marginal carina; T1 without dorsal basal fascia of pale hairs (S6 of female usually notched laterally)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Axilla short, not reaching posterior transverse tangent of scutellum; scutellum broadly rounded or subtriangular; T2 of male with sublateral, transverse, elongate fovea on surface behind gradulus (Fig. 84-7) (holarctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Xerocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 complete, clearly evident at midline (Fig. 84-2)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Xerocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): S6 of female without lateral notches; T2 of male without foveae

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Xerocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Carina of pronotal tubercle conspicuously elevated, forming lamella anterior to tegula; pubescence of thorax shorter, scutum nearly bare but with marginal lines or spots of pale tomentum; gradulus of T2 approaching apical margin of tergum medially (nearctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Coelioxys s. str.) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 complete, clearly evident at midline (Fig. 84-2)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Coelioxys s. str.) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): S6 of female without lateral notches; T2 of male without foveae

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Coelioxys s. str.) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Carina of pronotal tubercle not elevated, often obscured by long, dense, thoracic pubescence; scutum and scutellum more conspicuously pubescent, but without pale tomentose lines or spots; gradulus of T2 more nearly straight, not closely approaching apical tergal margin (holarctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Synocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Synocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Median ocellus partially surrounded by somewhat swollen and usually smooth portion of subocellar frontal area

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Synocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): S6 of female rounded or broadly angulate apically, with marginal fringe of short hairs, without subapical notch; metasoma of male with four exposed sterna, dorsal processes of T6 forming a transverse, irregularly crenulate plate (North and Central America)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Neocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Neocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Median ocellus partially surrounded by somewhat swollen and usually smooth portion of subocellar frontal area

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Neocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): S6 of female narrowed apically, without marginal fringe, with lateral subapical notch; metasoma of male with ﬁve exposed sterna, dorsal processes of T6 normal

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Acrocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Acrocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Acrocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Scutellum smooth, punctures well separated or sparse, hind margin carinate and usually angulate, projecting over metanotum and propodeum

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Scutellum usually well punctured, hind margin not carinate and not overlying metanotum except sometimes for a median angle or tubercle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Concavity of T1 lacking marginal carina; T1 without dorsal basal fascia of pale hairs (S6 of female usually notched laterally)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Boreocoelioxys) (in part) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Axilla short, not reaching posterior transverse tangent of scutellum; scutellum broadly rounded or subtriangular; T2 of male with sublateral, transverse, elongate fovea on surface behind gradulus (Fig. 84-7) (holarctic)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Glyptocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Glyptocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Subocellar area of frons usually closely punctate and quite ﬂat, but if with smooth swollen area, then usually with a few punctures or divided medially by punctate zone

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Glyptocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Scutellum usually well punctured, hind margin not carinate and not overlying metanotum except sometimes for a median angle or tubercle

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Glyptocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Concavity of T1 lacking marginal carina; T1 without dorsal basal fascia of pale hairs (S6 of female usually notched laterally)

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Glyptocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Axilla usually prominent; scutellum usually angulate or with median ridge or apical tubercle; T2 of male not foveate

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C. (Haplocoelioxys) of Coelioxys of the WesternHemisphere(Modiﬁed from Mitchell, 1973): Postgradular grooves of T2 and T3 interrupted medially, clearly evident only laterally

Title: Bees Of The World
Author: Daniel C. Danforth
Text Content: Characteristics to the Subgenera C.
